content:
Yes, there are several examples of soundtracks that were successful due to their timing of release:

1. The soundtrack to the movie "Purple Rain" was released alongside the movie in 1984, and it went on to become a huge commercial success. The album was Prince's sixth studio album, and its success was largely due to the popularity of the movie.

2. The soundtrack to the movie "Saturday Night Fever" was also released alongside the movie in 1977, and it went on to become one of the highest-selling soundtracks of all time. The album's success was due in part to its association with the disco era, which was at the height of its popularity at the time.

3. More recently, the soundtrack to the movie "Frozen" was released in 2013 alongside the movie, and it quickly became one of the highest-selling soundtracks in history. The album's success was due in part to the popularity of the movie and its hit single, "Let It Go."

In all of these cases, the timing of the soundtrack's release played a significant role in its success.
